pullRequest.title: DPC-754 add lookback failure reason to operation outcome
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes DPC-754
Currently, we return an operation outcome when a patient fails look back, either because the patient had no EoBs or the patient's EoBs did not match the look back criteria.  Our current pilot partner would like more insight into why a patient's EoBs would not pass look back, therefore we are now adding which criteria the EoBs failed for look back into the operation outcome.
Proposed Changes
Determine reason for look back failure by looking at the set of EoB's for a particular patient

Change Details

Determine reason for look back failure


Security Implications


 new software dependencies



 security controls or supporting software altered



 new data stored or transmitted



 security checklist is completed for this change



 requires more information or team discussion to evaluate security implications



 no PHI/PII is affected by this change


Acceptance Validation


Feedback Requested

commit.message: add lookback failure reason to operation outcome

nodes.bodyText: This message makes sense to us, but if it's passed on to a practitioner I'm not sure it's as meaningful ("lookback" isn't a universal term).  How about "No claims found; unable to demonstrate relationship with provider or organization" or something like that?
How about "No recent claims found from provider or organization"?  Though it should probably be different from the previous message.
How about "No recent claims found from provider or organization"?
How about "No claims found from provider or organization"?
